prompt: <description>**Construct the base part of the final shape.** The base part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a sloped side. The dimensions of the prism are 2 units in length, 1 unit in width, and 1 unit in height. The sloped side is at a 45 degree angle. The base part consists of a single coordinate system, a single sketch with one face and one loop, and an extrusion. **Coordinate System** Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] **Sketch** Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. The sketch contains one face and one loop, with a total of eight lines. - Face 1 Create a loop with the following lines: - Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.125] - Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.125], End Point [0.5, 0.125] - Line 4: Start Point [0.5, 0.125], End Point [0.5, 0.375] - Line 5: Start Point [0.5, 0.375], End Point [0.75, 0.375] - Line 6: Start Point [0.75, 0.375], End Point [0.75, 0.5] - Line 7: Start Point [0.75, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.5] - Line 8: Start Point [0.0, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.0] **Extrusion** Extrude the sketch in the positive Z direction by 0.25 units, maintaining the original sketch shape. The base part is now complete. It has the following dimensions: - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.25 units</description>

prompt: <description>** Part 1: Three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system. Set the Euler Angles to [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.375, 0.0, 0.0]. This will position the sketch in the correct orientation and location. Now, let's move on to the sketching stage. The sketch will be drawn on a plane defined by the coordinate system. The sketch consists of one face, and this face contains one loop. Face 1: * Loop 1: + Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.5, 0.0] + Line 2: Start Point [0.5, 0.0], End Point [0.5, 0.5] + Line 3: Start Point [0.5, 0.5], End Point [0.0, 0.0] The loop forms a triangle. It is important to note that the loop is closed since its start and end points are the same. Now, let's move on to the extrusion stage. We'll be using the extrusion depth values of 0.1875 towards the normal and 0.1875 opposite the normal. Additionally, we'll apply a sketch scale of 0.5. Extrusion: * Extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.1875 * Extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.1875 * Sketch_scale: 0.5 * Operation: Create a new solid body This extrusion will make the 2D sketch a 3D solid geometry. ** Part 2: Three-dimensional geometric shape with a flat base and a triangular top, connected by a straight line** Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.375, 0.0, 0.0] This will position the sketch correctly. Sketch on the plane of the coordinate system with the following components: Face 1: * Loop 1: + Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.25, 0.0] + Line 2: Start Point [0.25, 0.0], End Point [0.25, 0.25] + Line 3: Start Point [0.25, 0.25], End Point [0.0, 0.0] These lines complete a triangle shape with a closed loop. Now, proceed with the extrusion. Use the following parameters: Extrusion: * Extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.125 * Extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.125 * Sketch_scale: 0.25 * Operation: Cut a feature from the existing body This will create a new 3D solid by removing the sketch geometry from the existing solid created from part 1. With these instructions, you can generate the parametric CAD model mentioned in the given JSON. Make sure to follow the dimensions provided in the JSON carefully for accurate results.</description>

On this face, create a single loop (loop\\_1) as follows: - Loop\\_1: - Line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.4219, 0.0] - Line\\_2: Start Point [0.4219, 0.0], End Point [0.4219, 0.75] - Line\\_3: Start Point [0.4219, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] - Line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] This loop fully encloses an area creating a single face in the sketch. Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketch Now extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction WITH a depth of 0.2344 and AGAINST the opposite normal direction with a depth of 0. Apply the following scaling parameter to the extrusion: 0.75. Perform a "New Body Feature Operation" as the BOOLEAN operation during this extrusion step. Summary Create a rectangular prism with the following dimensions: - Shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the length of the sides. - Length: 0.75 m (3/4 m) - Width: 0.234 m (23.4 cm or 9.2125 in) - Height: 0.374 m (37.4 cm or 14.7244 in) Continue with these instructions for each part in the "CAD Assembly JSON". Each part has its own unique shape, dimensions, and processes.</description>
